intro: Alsinopsis propinqua, commonly known as the narrowleaf alsinopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent structure. Alsinopsis propinqua is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for xerophytic gardens.
